channel.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
channel.description:
Hello. It's been quite a while since I've posted here. But anyway, here is my problem.
Some months ago my hard-disk died, mainly because of my failure. I had Ubuntu/linux on the 2nd hard-disk and windows on the first. So i tried to install a new version of ubuntu onto the 2nd hard-disk with the ubuntu update manager or something like that. My computer froze in the middle of the update because a problem with the graphics card I figured out some time ago. I had no choice back then, than to shut down the computer. That is where the problem is coming from. I tried to boot up ubuntu onto the hard-disk it is installed on. It just said some boot up thingy was missing and just shut down the computer. Now I went onto windows and tried to find the hard-disk in the windows file manager. I found the disk but it was unreachable or not able to do anything with it. I tried using a ubuntu live cd, I did find the hard-disk, but was not able to anything to it. It was like a disk you cannot see or touch, it just was there :(
Have any of you that is reading this had any problems like this before? Or do anyone know how to get life back to my beloved hard-disk? I had so many important files on that disk. I still have a hope, a hope that someday the files will be mine again.
Thank you for reading this. Yours sincerely kneistol :)

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

I assume it’s dead becuase it’s not working the way i want it to do. And because it’s not responding in linux or windows. It may just be corrupted. But thats worse than dead About the partitions. I think there is only one partition used to run linux on it, so probably not ntfs or fat…

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Why do you assume its dead? A disk with no Windows readable partitions won’t show up anywhere except disk manager - does it have a complete partition table/any ntfs or fat partitions?

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Odd that a failed installation corrupted everything >.<

What does it do if you plug it into a fully functioning computer so that it doesn’t have to try to boot from it

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

if you’re desperate to get the files back you can spend it to harddrive recovery specialists

it will cost, and if you have anything illegal on there they will have to report it, they shouldn’t look but hey

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

I tried it… The hard-disk is gone from everything i boot it up with It couldn’t find the files

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

hirens boot cd may be able to recover data

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:4, topic:454138”][quote author=kneistol link=topic=557010.msg4076888#msg4076888 date=1344922114]
It turns on spinning. And then all of a sudden it turns off and then turns on again. It keeps doing that for a long time… until it boots up from a cd i have put in. So it makes this “bmffmfmmf” sound and the disk stops spinning. It means there is life in the disk. But something is wrong.
[/quote]

Sounds similar to my old external HD. It started spinning, and then you could hear the read arm tick and then it stopped again. Dead as a dodo. But maybe yours can still be saved.[/quote]

Any idea on howto?

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

kneistol:

It turns on spinning. And then all of a sudden it turns off and then turns on again. It keeps doing that for a long time… until it boots up from a cd i have put in. So it makes this “bmffmfmmf” sound and the disk stops spinning. It means there is life in the disk. But something is wrong.

Sounds similar to my old external HD. It started spinning, and then you could hear the read arm tick and then it stopped again. Dead as a dodo. But maybe yours can still be saved.

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

Niall:

If you can see the drive but can’t access it, download a program that will give you SMART data from the drives. That should give some indication of if it is fucked.

I downloaded a program called “DiskCheckup a SMART way to check your disk” And the only thing it finds is my first harddisk. Th second harddisk won’t show up as a disk. But in device manager the disc is there i believe. Under “DiskDrives” there is my first harddisk and the usb ports. Nothing else. But when I open “other devices” there is a “SCSI Disk Device” there.
I believe that is the dead harddisk. I can open the properties of it. The device is working properly it says. But It’s not
Whats happening to it? The SMART program could not find it. The only place I can find it is in device manager. But as a disk i cant reach but is working properly

EDIT: If this helps. When i disconnect the normal windows hard-disk. And just plugs in the first one. It turns on spinning. And then all of a sudden it turns off and then turns on again. It keeps doing that for a long time… until it boots up from a cd i have put in. So it makes this “bmffmfmmf” sound and the disk stops spinning. It means there is life in the disk. But something is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Second Harddisk is dead :(
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If you can see the drive but can’t access it, download a program that will give you SMART data from the drives. That should give some indication of if it is fucked.

Read full topic
